{{cpp/title|acos{{small|(std::valarray)}}}}
{{cpp/numeric/valarray/navbar}}
{{ddcl|header=valarray|1=
template&lt; class T &gt;
valarray&lt;T&gt; acos( const valarray&lt;T&gt;&amp; va );
}}

For each element in {{c|va}} computes arc cosine of the value of the element.

===Parameters===
{{par begin}}
{{par|va|value array to apply the operation to}}
{{par end}}

===Return value===
Value array containing arc cosines of the values in {{c|va}}.

===Notes===
{{cpp/numeric/valarray/notes unq|acos}}

{{cpp/numeric/valarray/notes ret|acos}}

===Possible implementation===
{{cpp/numeric/valarray/impl|acos}}

===Example===
{{example
|code=
#include &lt;cmath&gt;
#include &lt;iostream&gt;
#include &lt;numbers&gt;
#include &lt;valarray&gt;

int main()
{
    // take common x-values from unit circle
    const double s32 = std::sqrt(3.0) / 2.0;
    const double s22 = std::sqrt(2.0) / 2.0;
    std::valarray&lt;double&gt; v1 = {-1.0, -s32, -s22, -0.5, 0.0, 0.5, s22, s32, 1.0};
    std::valarray&lt;double&gt; v2 = std::acos(v1) * 180.0 / std::numbers::pi;

    for (double n : v2)
        std::cout &lt;&lt; n &lt;&lt; "° ";
    std::cout &lt;&lt; '\n';
}
|output=180° 150° 135° 120° 90° 60° 45° 30° 0°
}}
